endpoints.title: Assign IP (Requires Security: Cloud UI)

params.name: tenant
params.description: Optional. Defaults to 'ssnc'. The tenant the IP address should reside in.

params.name: site
params.description: Optional. However the site and tenant\_vpc cannot both be absent in the request.

params.name: tenant_vpc
params.description: Optional. Then name of the tenant's VPC to allocate an VM IP in

params.name: name
params.description: Required. Used to attach a description to the IP record.

params.name: zone
params.description: Optional. This is to ensure distribution of IPs for the zone across multiple subnets.

params.name: network
params.description: Optional. To allocate an IP in a specific SDN subnet. If network is specified, this overrides the zone option.

params.name: ip
params.description: Optional. Assigns input IP if specified. The network the subnet is in is required

endpoints.title: Delete IP (Requires Security: Cloud UI)

params.name: tenant
params.description: Optional. Defaults to 'ssnc'. The tenant the IP address should reside in.

params.name: ip
params.description: Required. Specify the IP address to delete.

params.name: delete_now
params.description: Optional. Default is false IP will be retained for 24 hours in IPAM. True will cause IPAM deletion on next deletion cycle within 1 hour.

params.name: name
params.description: Optional. Can be provided as additional validation. Skynet will check the name matches the description on the IP in IPAM before proceeding with the delete.

endpoints.title: Create Security Zone (Requires Security: CLOUD\_UI, NETWORK)

params.name: zone
params.description: Required. URL parameter specifying the zone name. Must be 64 or fewer characters.

params.name: tenant
params.description: Required. Query string specifying the tenant name. Must be 8 or fewer characters.

params.name: intrazone_access
params.description: Optional. Default False. Whether to enable intrazone access for the zone.

params.name: protected_membership
params.description: Optional. Default null. Must be 'segment', 'ip', or null. Protects the zone by allowing endpoints to be only NSX segments, ip type endpoints, or mixed membership (null).

params.name: tags
params.description: Optional. Dictionary of tags to apply to the zone. Currently tags are not used in policy decisions but are attached to the VMs if specified.

endpoints.title: Create Security Zone Endpoints (Requires Security: CLOUD\_UI, NETWORK)

params.name: zone
params.description: Required. URL parameter specifying the zone name. Must be 64 or fewer characters.

params.name: tenant
params.description: Required. Query string specifying the tenant name. Must be 8 or fewer characters.

params.name: endpoints
params.description: Required. List of endpoints to add to zone.

params.name: name
params.description: Required if endpoints in included. This must match the VM name as it exists in NSX if it is a Cloud based VM.

params.name: ip
params.description: Required if endpoints is included. This is the IP of the endpoint, or a network.

params.name: segment
params.description: Optional. Default null. Sets a network endpoint as an NSX segment. Must be an exact name match to the NSX segment.

params.name: nsx_ip_only
params.description: Optional. Default false. Indicates this endpoint should be processed on NSX Firewalls as IP Only (no VM tagging) - cannot be used with segment option.

endpoints.title: POST Load Balancer Functions (Requires Security: Cloud UI)

params.name: tenant
params.description: Optional. Defaults to 'ssnc'.

params.name: action
params.description: Optional. Can be add or delete.

params.name: site
params.description: Optional. However the site and tenant\_vpc cannot both be absent in the request.

params.name: tenant_vpc
params.description: Optional. Then name of the tenant's VPC to allocate an VM IP in

params.name: type
params.description: Required. VIP type. Can be enterprise, extranet, internet.

params.name: tenant
params.description: Optional. The tenant the VIP belongs in. This will default to SSNC if unspecified.

params.name: health_check
params.description: Option. This will default based on the VIP type if unspecified.

params.name: fqdn
params.description: Required. The fully qualified name of the VIP. Maximum length is 64 characters.

params.name: new_fqdn
params.description: Optional. The new name of the FQDN if specified or not null (DNS update).

params.name: pool_members
params.description: Optional. A list of existing server pool members.

params.name: health_check
params.description: Optional. Specify TCP, UDP, HTTP, or HTTPS

params.name: http_health_check
params.description: Optional. Specify dictionary regex GET/RECEIVE strings for building HTTP health check.

params.name: http_health_check_port
params.description: Optional. Specify port that the http health check should check on server.

params.name: protocol
params.description: Required. Specify HTTP, TCP or UPD.

params.name: http_profiles
params.description: Optional. Array of http profile strings (see GET for available options).

params.name: websocket
params.description: Optional. Enable websocket. (Bool)

params.name: fastL4
params.description: Optional. True/False. Enable the VIP to be of type "Performance (Layer 4)"

params.name: irules
params.description: Optional. Array of hash tables. Keys are "name" (for the irule name within F5) and "code" for the irule code.

params.name: increased_buffer
params.description: Optional. True/False

params.name: persistence_profile
params.description: Required. none, cookie, source\_addr

params.name: server_ssl
params.description: Optional. Single string for the server side ssl profile, see GET for available options.

params.name: http2
params.description: Optional. Optional http2 setting string, valid options for http2 are "passthrough", "proxy", or "disabled".

params.name: loadbalancing_mode
params.description: Optional. Single string for the loadbalancing mode, can be least-connections-member or round-robin (default).

params.name: cloudflare_proxied
params.description: A bool, indicating whether or not to set the CloudFlare proxied option. (Internet type only, defaults to True)

endpoints.example:
{
    "action": "add|delete",
    "tenant": "<tenant>",
    "site": "<site>",
    "tenant_vpc": "<tenant_vpc>",
    "name": "<arbitrary description for the virtual>",
    "type": "enterprise|extranet|internet",
    "fqdn": "<fqdn>",
    "tenant": "<tenant>",
    "new_fqdn": "<new_fqdn>",
    "port": "<virtual port>",
    "pool_members": ["<list specified as: <ip>:<port>, ..."],
    "persistence_profile": "none|cookie|source_addr",
    "ssl_termination": true|false,
    "health_check": "tcp|udp|http|https",
    "http_health_check": {
        "GET": "<equal allowed F5 input>",
        "response": "<allowed F5 input>"
    },
    "http_health_check_port" : integer,
    "protcol": "http|tcp|udp",
    "http_profiles": ["x-forward-proto"],
    "websocket": true|false
    "fastL4": true|false,
    "irules": [{
        "name": "<irule name>",
        "code": "priority 100\nwhen CLIENT_ACCEPTED {\n\tlog local0. \"test\"\n}"
    }],
    "network": "<network required for non-default scenarios: VPCs or multi-tenants sharing VPC>"
}

endpoints.title: Create GSLB WIP (Requires Security: Cloud UI)

params.name: tenant
params.description: Optional. The default is 'ssnc'

params.name: wip
params.description: Required. The FQDN of the GSLB entry.

params.name: lb_method
params.description: Required. The load balancing method of the GSLB WIP. Valid options are "global-availability", "round-robin", and "static-persistence". Global Availability: BIG-IP GTM distributes DNS name resolution requests to the first available virtual server in a pool. Over time, the first virtual server in the list receives the most requests and the last virtual server in the list receives the least requests. Round-Robin: BIG-IP GTM distributes DNS name resolution requests in a circular and sequential pattern among the virtual servers in a pool. Over time each virtual server receives an equal number of requests. Static Persist: BIG-IP GTM distributes DNS name resolution requests to the first available virtual server in a pool using the persist mask with the source IP address of the LDNS and a hash algorithm to determine the order of the virtual servers in the list. This hash algorithm orders the virtual servers in the list differently for each LDNS that is passing traffic to the system taking into account the specified CIDR of the LDNS. Each LDNS (and thus each client) generally resolves to the same virtual server; however, when the selected virtual server becomes unavailable, BIG-IP GTM sends requests to another virtual server until the original virtual server becomes available. Then BIG-IP GTM again resolves requests to that virtual server.

params.name: loadbalancers
params.description: Required. An array of load-balancer VIPs having a minimum of 1 entry.

params.name: site
params.description: Required. The supported DC site that the local VIPs are deployed at.

params.name: fqdn
params.description: Required. The FQDN of the VIP at the local LB.

params.name: lb_port
params.description: Required. The port number of the VIP at the local LB.

params.name: lb_type
params.description: Optional. The lb type, either "lb" (an existing lb vip) or "host" (generic host / VM). Defaults to "lb" if omitted. Note - "host" lb\_type required DNS A record FQDNs be provided in the loadbalancers section.

params.name: order
params.description: Optional. Must be specified for global-availability LB option. The lowest active local LB is exclusively used.

params.name: cloudflare_proxied
params.description: A bool, indicating whether or not to set the CloudFlare proxied option. (Internet GSLBs only, defaults to True)

params.name: provider
params.description: Optional. Either 'F5' or 'Cloudflare' (should only be used by network team for migrations).

Global Availability: BIG-IP GTM distributes DNS name resolution requests to the first available virtual server in a pool. Over time, the first virtual server in the list receives the most requests and the last virtual server in the list receives the least requests. Round-Robin: BIG-IP GTM distributes DNS name resolution requests in a circular and sequential pattern among the virtual servers in a pool. Over time each virtual server receives an equal number of requests. Static Persist: BIG-IP GTM distributes DNS name resolution requests to the first available virtual server in a pool using the persist mask with the source IP address of the LDNS and a hash algorithm to determine the order of the virtual servers in the list. This hash algorithm orders the virtual servers in the list differently for each LDNS that is passing traffic to the system taking into account the specified CIDR of the LDNS. Each LDNS (and thus each client) generally resolves to the same virtual server; however, when the selected virtual server becomes unavailable, BIG-IP GTM sends requests to another virtual server until the original virtual server becomes available. Then BIG-IP GTM again resolves requests to that virtual server.

params.name: loadbalancers

params.name: site

params.name: fqdn

{
    "devices":
    [
        {
            "site": "<site>",
            "fabric": "<fabric>",
            "location": "<rack location>",
            "action": "add",
            "device_type": "<device type (svr)>",
            "hostname": "<hostname>",

                    "speed": "1G",

                    "vrf": "DC"
                }
            ],
        }
    ]
}

params.name: vlan_definition_id
params.description: Optional. The VLAN definition ID to retrieve VLAN information for.

endpoints.title: Create SDN VLAN (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: site
params.description: Required. The site name for the new VLAN.

params.name: tenant
params.description: Required. The tenant name for the new VLAN.

params.name: vlan_type
params.description: Required. The type of VLAN to create. See [SDN 2.0 documentation](https://code.ssnc.dev/tech-infra/na-common/wiki/SDN-2.0:-From-Greenfield-to-Production-API-Guide#new-vlan-api) for more details.

params.name: vlan_sub_type
params.description: Optional. The sub-type of the VLAN to create. See [SDN 2.0 documentation](https://code.ssnc.dev/tech-infra/na-common/wiki/SDN-2.0:-From-Greenfield-to-Production-API-Guide#new-vlan-api) for more details.

params.name: vlan_ranges
params.description: Required. The VLAN ranges to create. Can be a single VLAN `850`, a range of VLANs `850-855`, a comma separated list `850, 852, 855`, or a combmination `850, 852-853, 855`.

params.name: description
params.description: Required. A description of the new VLAN. This should be descriptive, will be used in the VLAN name, and should be less than 20 characters.

params.name: fabric
params.description: Required. The fabric to create the VLAN on. Options are `cloud` or `mgmt`.

params.name: pods
params.description: Required. A list of pods to create the VLAN on. The first pod is the primary pod, any following pods will be linked to the primary pod via created subnets.

params.name: vrf
params.description: Required. The VRF to create the VLAN in.

params.name: deployment
params.description: Required. The deployment type of the VLAN. Options are `static`, `hybrid`, or `dynamic`. `static` defines a single VLAN with one ID and one subnet. `hybrid` will allocate all available VLAN IDs specified in the `vlan_ranges` field until the IDs run out or the available subnets in the `networks` field run out. This is up to a limit of 5. `dynamic` will create a VLAN definition that will auto-allocate VLANs using the `vlan_ranges` field and supernet block defined in the `networks` field; this happens dynamically as IPs run out for currently assigned subnets.

params.name: firewalled
params.description: Required. A boolean flag to indicate if the VLAN is behind a firewall or not. This primarily just adds the `nowfw` tag on the end of the environment name.

params.name: networks
params.description: Required. A list of networks to create subnets entries for. Allocation depends on the `deployment` type.

params.name: network_prefix_length
params.description: Optional. Defaults to 24. This is an integer for the prefix length of networks to be allocated. This is primarily only significant for `dynamic` allocation.

params.name: dhcp
params.description: Required. The DHCP type for the VLAN. Options are `host` (ID 10), `management` (ID 9), or `none`. If the DHCP Skynet ID is known, that can also be supplied as an integer.

params.name: update_ipam
params.description: Required. A boolean flag to indicate if the VLAN should be added to IPAM systems.

params.name: env_override
params.description: Optional. A JSON object to override the env and host\_type fields from the defaults generated by the vlan\_type. Both key/value pairs must be provided. Ex. `{"env": "wc2cloudvm", "host_type": "sdn_esxi"}`. \*\* **NOT RECOMMENDED TO USE THE OVERRIDE UNLESS CONFIDENT THAT IT IS CORRECT AND NECESSARY**.

endpoints.example:
# HYBRID EXAMPLE...
{
    "site": "mp1",
    "tenant": "ssnc",
    "vlan_type": "physical",
    "vlan_sub_type": null,
    "vlan_ranges": "850-855",
    "description": "Test Physical",
    "fabric": "cloud",
    "pods": [
        "p01"
    ],
    "vrf": "DC",
    "deployment": "hybrid",
    "firewalled": false,
    "networks": [
        "6.101.110.0/24",
        "6.101.111.0/24"
    ],
    "dhcp": "host",
    "update_ipam": true
}

# DYNAMIC EXAMPLE...
{
    "site": "wc3",
    "tenant": "ssnc",
    "vlan_type": "vm",
    "vlan_sub_type": null,
    "vlan_ranges": "201-210",
    "description": "wc3 vm compute",
    "fabric": "cloud",
    "pods": [
        "p01"
    ],
    "vrf": "DC",
    "deployment": "dynamic",
    "firewalled": true,
    "networks": [
        "6.98.0.0/19"
    ],
    "network_prefix_length": 26,
    "dhcp": null,
    "update_ipam": true
}

# STATIC EXAMPLE...
{
    "site": "mel",
    "tenant": "ssnc",
    "vlan_type": "physical",
    "vlan_sub_type": null,
    "vlan_ranges": "602",
    "description": "Test Physical2",
    "fabric": "cloud",
    "pods": [
        "p01"
    ],
    "vrf": "DC",
    "deployment": "static",
    "firewalled": true,
    "networks": [
        "1.2.4.0/24"
    ],
    "dhcp": null,
    "update_ipam": true
}

# VPC SEGMENT EXAMPLE...
{
    "site": "lab",
    "tenant": "ukifds",
    "vlan_type": "vpc",
    "vlan_sub_type": "ssnc-labp1d11-vm",
    "vlan_ranges": "0",
    "description": "test ukifds segment",
    "fabric": "cloud",
    "pods": [
        "p01"
    ],
    "vrf": "DC",
    "deployment": "dynamic",
    "firewalled": true,
    "networks": [
        "7.101.0.0/22"
    ],
    "dhcp": null,
    "update_ipam": true
}

endpoints.title: Update SDN VLAN (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: vlan_definition_id
params.description: Required. The VLAN definition ID for VLAN to update.

params.name: vlan_ranges
params.description: Optional; Replaces the existing ranges. The VLAN ranges to update. Can be a single VLAN `850`, a range of VLANs `850-855`, a comma separated list `850, 852, 855`, or a combination `850, 852-853, 855`.

params.name: networks
params.description: Optional; Replaces the existing networks. A list of networks to create subnets entries for. Allocation depends on the `deployment` type.

params.name: network_prefix_length
params.description: Optional; Replaces existing prefix length settings. This is an integer for the prefix length of networks to be allocated. Primarily only used for VLANs that were deployed (POST) as `dynamic` deployment.

params.name: pods
params.description: Optional; Replaces the existing pods. A list of pods to update the VLAN in. The first pod is the primary pod, any following pods will be linked to the primary pod via created subnets.

params.name: vrf
params.description: Optional. Updates the VRF to a new specified VRF (SDN2.0 VRFs only).

params.name: deployment
params.description: Optional; Options are `hybrid` or `no_alloc`. The deployment type of the VLAN for the PATCH; similar to deployment on POST, but drives the PATCH actions on subnets. `hybrid` allows provisioning of additional networks based on available VLAN ID ranges and networks (up to 5); this will work with previously deployed `static` or `hybrid` VLANs from the POST request. `no_alloc` will not attempt to provision additional networks. The `dynamic` deployment option from the POST is not available here as those networks will only be allocated with the dynamic proces, use `no_alloc` for those.

params.name: minimum_available_ips
params.description: Optional; The minimum number of available IPs to maintain in the subnet. This will be used to determine if additional subnets need to be created (only matters with `dynamic` VLANs; however, will update the field regardless).

params.name: update_ipam
params.description: Optional; A boolean flag to indicate if the VLAN should be added to IPAM systems when new VLAN subnets are allocated with `hybrid` deployment.

params.name: env_override
params.description: Optional. A JSON object to override the env and host\_type fields from the defaults generated by the vlan\_type. Both key/value pairs must be provided. Ex. `{"env": "wc2cloudvm", "host_type": "sdn_esxi"}`. \*\* **NOT RECOMMENDED TO USE THE OVERRIDE UNLESS CONFIDENT THAT IT IS CORRECT AND NECESSARY**.

endpoints.title: Delete SDN VLAN (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: update_ipam
params.description: Required. A boolean flag to indicate if the VLAN should be removed from IPAM systems.

endpoints.title: Add Firewall (Requires Security: ADMIN, NETSUPER)

params.name: firewall_name
params.description: Required. The name of the firewall to add.

params.name: type
params.description: Required. The type of firewall being added. Currently only `pa` (Palo Alto) is supported for `NETSUPER`. `ADMIN` permissions required to add other types (`asa`, `openshift`, `nsx`, `juniper`).

params.name: device_id
params.description: Optional. A device\_id reference; currently only used by `openshift` firewalls for clusters to reference the cluster\_group entry.

params.name: env
params.description: Optional. The primary environment the firewall is in, generally low use for `nsx` and some `pa`.

params.name: use_sub_zones
params.description: Optional. A boolean flag to indicate if sub-zones should be used for the firewall. Only used for `asa` firewalls.

params.name: properties
params.description: Required for `pa` firewalls. Optional for all others. A JSON object containing the properties for the firewall. See below for sub-fields.

params.name: cordon_to_instance
params.description: Optional. A boolean flag to indicate if the firewall should be cordoned off to a specific Skynet instance. `ADMIN` used only.

params.name: edge
params.description: Required for `pa` firewalls. Optional for all others. A boolean flag to indicate if the firewall is an edge firewall.

params.name: panorama
params.description: Required for `pa` firewalls. Not used for others. The panorama hostname or IP address managing the firewall.

params.name: firewalls
params.description: Required for `pa` firewalls. The list of firewalls, used only by `pa` as the firewall entry is the device group. This represents the real firewalls in the device group.

params.name: cluster_group_id
params.description: Optional. For `openshift` firewalls. The cluster group ID the firewall belongs to.

params.name: is_cluster_group
params.description: Optional. For `openshift` firewalls. A boolean flag to indicate if the firewall is a cluster group.

params.name: properties

params.name: edge

params.name: panorama
params.description: Optional. The panorama hostname or IP address managing the firewall.

params.name: firewalls
params.description: Optional. The list of firewalls, used only by `pa` as the firewall entry is the device group. This represents the real firewalls in the device group.

params.name: cluster_group_id

params.name: maintenance_device_age

endpoints.title: Get SDN Cable Map Topology by Name or ID (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: topology_name
params.description: Optional. Required if topology\_id not included. This is the name of the topology to return. Will return the enabled (newest) topology with the name. Must be the exact name.

params.name: topology_id
params.description: Optional. Required if topology\_name not included. This is the id of the topology to return. Will return the topology with the specific id number.

endpoints.title: Request a new SDN Cable Map Topology Build, Add New Devices to an Existing Topology, or Remove Devices from an Existing Topology (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: request_action
params.description: Required. Set value to 'build' to create a new topology, 'add' to add a device to an existing topology, or 'remove' to remove a device from an existing topology.

params.name: request
params.description: Required. JSON object that includes the layer, and for each layer, the list devices to build, add, or remove. See below for details on specific fields.

params.name: topology_name
params.description: Required. Name to give a new topology for a 'build' request. For an 'add' or 'remove' request, must be exact name of existing topology. If planning to register the topology to production, this name should be the site code for the new SDN site

params.name: topology_profile_name
params.description: Required. Name of the topology profile to associate to the requested topology. See `/api/v4/sdn/arista/cable_profile`.

params.name: test
params.description: Optional. Boolean value; default is 'false'. Set to 'true' to return a new topology or changes to a topology without writing results to the database.

params.name: recable_endpoints
params.description: Optional. Boolean value; default is 'true'. If 'true', this parameter is used with the 'remove' request\_action to have endpoints assign new uplink interfaces to another device dynamically if the device they are connected to is removed.

endpoints.title: Delete an Existing Topology from the Database by ID (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: topology_id
params.description: Required. This is the id of the topology to delete. Can only be deleted if it is not 'enabled'.

endpoints.title: Get SDN Cable Map Topology Profiles (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: profile_id
params.description: Optional. This is the id of the profiles data to return.

params.name: profile_name
params.description: Optional. The name of the profiles data to return.

endpoints.title: Request to Create or Update an SDN Cable Map Topology Profile and Model Defaults (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: profile_name
params.description: Required. The name of the profile to create/update. This is a unique field, duplicate names are not allowed.

params.name: profiles_request
params.description: Optional. Required if no defaults\_request. JSON object that defines the profile as 'device' or 'endpoint', then sets the layers to uplink to with allowed interface range. Also includes interface totals data. See below for details on specific fields.

params.name: defaults_request
params.description: Optional. Required if no profiles\_request. JSON object that defines default device or endpoint models for a particular sdn layer. See below for details on specific fields.

endpoints.title: Delete an Existing Profile Data Entry from the Database by ID (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: profile_id
params.description: Required. This is the id of the profile data set to delete. Can only be deleted if it is not 'enabled'.

endpoints.title: Register Arista Cable Topology (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: topology_name
params.description: Required. Site code for which to register topology.

params.name: topology_type
params.description: Required. Must be one of: `small_dc`, `large_dc`, `small_campus`, `medium_campus`, `large_campus`.

params.name: topology_description
params.description: Required. Short description of the topology/site.

params.name: topology_skip_network_assignment
params.description: Optional. Boolean. Default is `false`, set to `true` to skip running any network/subnet assignment for the new topology (will not build/allocate subnets in IPAM)

params.name: topology_supernet
params.description: Optional. Supernet to be used by the topology. Must be /19 or larger, i.e. `5.1.0.0/19`, `5.1.0.0/18`, `5.1.0.0/17`, etc. Cannot be larger than /8. This is required if topology\_skip\_network\_assignment is false.

params.name: topology_set_supernet
params.description: Optional. Boolean. Default is `true`, set to `false` to skip allocating the supernet in IPAM (ex. if supernet is already allocated in IPAM, can set this so as not to cause registration to fail when it finds existing entry)

params.name: topology_assign_subnets
params.description: Optional. Boolean. Specifies whether Skynet will automatically provision subnets for infrastructure vlans. Set to false if you would prefer to assign these manually via `topology_custom_subnets` parameter.

params.name: topology_custom_subnets
params.description: Optional. JSON Object describing the subnets to assign to each default VLAN definition.

params.name: topology_public_asn
params.description: Optional. Override the public ASN used by the internet/isp edge switches by specifying the public\_asn and device\_layer. This is a JSON object (i.e. `{"public_asn": 14792, "device_layer": "isp_edge"}`.

params.name: topology_inet_public_nat_network
params.description: Optional. Provide a network to be used for public NAT space for the site. Must be in CIDR notation (10.10.10.0/24).

params.name: topology_add_new_vrfs
params.description: Optional. List. Provide a list of new VRFs to provision along with the new site. The default VRFs do not need included here (i.e. DC, INET, CLIENT, MGMT, MOM). This list requires a JSON object in the same format as http://network-api-docs.ssnc-corp.cloud/#vrf-create-post-requires-security-network

params.name: topology_process_new_edges
params.description: Optional. Boolean. If new edge (eg) types are included in this topology, this flag can be set to `true` (default is `false`) to automatically provision the edge profile.

params.name: topology_new_edges_vrfs
params.description: Optional. If processing `topology_process_new_edges`, provide a list of VRFs that will be available to the new edge types - this can include both default VRFs and any new VRFs defined by `topology_add_new_vrfs`

params.name: topology_services
params.description: Optional. A json object containing common config overrides for this topology. See table below for options.

params.name: key:_network_cidr
params.description: Required. The key for the custom subnet JSON object; it must be a string of the subnet to assign in CIDR notation. The value should be an object with the following parameters.

params.name: pod
params.description: Required. The pod to associate to this subnet/vlan. (ex. `p00`, `p01`).

params.name: fabric
params.description: Required. The fabric to associate to this subnet/vlan (ex. `cloud`, `mgmt`).

params.name: vlan_name
params.description: Required. The vlan name to associate to this subnet/vlan; if this is not a vlan, must still have this value, it will just be the name of the subnet. Must match the vlan name exactly from the default vlan definitions template.

params.name: dns_servers
params.description: Optional. A list of DNS server IPs to be used by devices in the topology.

params.name: ntp_servers
params.description: Optional. A list of NTP server IPs to be used by devices in the topology.

params.name: dhcp_servers
params.description: Optional. A list of DHCP server IPs to be used by devices in the topology.

params.name: tacacs_servers
params.description: Optional. A list of TACACS server objects to be used by devices in the topology. See table below for options.

params.name: cloud_vision_servers
params.description: Optional. A list of Cloud Vision server objects to be used by devices in the topology. See table below for options.

params.name: enterprise_domain
params.description: Optional. Domain to be used by devices in the topology.

params.name: default_dhcp_servers_site
params.description: Optional. The site code for a different site that this new topology/site will use the DHCP servers from when creating the initial DHCP scopes

params.name: tacacs_address
params.description: Required. The IP address of the TACACS server.

params.name: tacacs_key
params.description: Required.

params.name: tacacs_vrf
params.description: Required. Which VRF TACACS traffic should use to reach the TACACS server.

params.name: site_code
params.description: Required. The name of the site/topology where the Cloud Vision server resides.

params.name: cvp_address
params.description: Required. The IP address of the Cloud Vision server.

params.name: cvp_key
params.description: Required.

params.name: cvp_port
params.description: Required. The port on which Cloud Vision is listening.

params.name: primary_cluster
params.description: Required. True/False. Designates whether this Cloud Vision server is part of the primary cluster.

params.name: method
params.description: Optional. Default is `key`. This is the Daemon Terminattr setting; options are `key` or `token`.

endpoints.title: Add Device Profile Component (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: profile_scope
params.description: Required. Must either be `global`, or to limit the scope of use, the name of a specific topology (the topology name is always the same as the site name).

params.name: device_model_type
params.description: Required. Model type for the device, must be either `endpoint_model` or `device_model`

params.name: device_model
params.description: Required. The name of the device model.

params.name: layer_type
params.description: Required. Must be one of `ag`, `con`, `eg`, `esxi`, `lf`, `sdwan`, `sp`, `ss`

params.name: device_layer
params.description: Required. Layer at which this device operates, i.e. `leaf_compute`, `super_spine`, `spine_edge`, etc.

params.name: link_type
params.description: Required. Type of connection to `neighbor_layer`, i.e. `uplinks`, `peer_links`, etc.

params.name: neighbor_layer
params.description: Required. Layer of the device to which this device will connect.

params.name: interface_start
params.description: Optional. Required if `interface_labeled_ranges` field is null. The start of the interface range this device will use to connect to defined `neighbor_layer`.

params.name: interface_end
params.description: Optional. Required if `interface_labeled_ranges` field is null. The end of the interface range this device will use to connect to defined `neighbor_layer`.

params.name: interface_labeled_ranges
params.description: Optional. Required if `interface_start/end` fields are null. See below parameters section for more details.

params.name: description
params.description: Optional. This will be overwritten with `global` if `profile_scope` is set to `global`.

params.name: label_name
params.description: Required. Each key inside `interface_labeled_ranges` is the name of the range. The other parameters are sub-keys in the JSON data under the label\_name.

params.name: start
params.description: Required. The start of the interface range this device will use to connect to defined `neighbor_layer` for this labeled range.

params.name: end
params.description: Required. The end of the interface range this device will use to connect to defined `neighbor_layer` for this labeled range.

params.name: mapping
params.description: Required. The mapping type used for this labeled range of interfaces. One of: `primary`, `secondary`, `primary_secondary`, `secondary_primary` - determines which cabinet and/or cross-cabinet cabling used.

params.name: profile_scope

params.name: device_layer
params.description: Required. Layer at which this device operates, i.e. `leaf_compute`, `super_spine`, `spine_edge`, etc.

params.name: device_pod
params.description: Required. Pod in which this device will reside.

params.name: device_cabinet
params.description: Required. Cabinet where this device will reside.

params.name: device_service_cabinet
params.description: Optional. Generally used for leaf switches, this parameter specifies that the device can uplink to spines in other cabinets besides its own. If not provided, this device can only uplink to switches in its local cabinet.

params.name: device_management_cabinet
params.description: Optional. This is the cabinet where the desired management switch resides. If not provided, this device will not be provisioned a management interface.

params.name: device_console_cabinet
params.description: Optional. This is the cabinet where the desired console switch resides. If not provided, this device will not be provisioned a console interface.

params.description: Required. The name of the device model.

params.name: device_pod
params.description: Required. Pod in which this device will reside.

params.name: device_cabinet
params.description: Required. Cabinet where this device will reside.

params.name: device_service_cabinet
params.description: Optional. This parameter specifies that the device can uplink to switches in other cabinets besides its own. If not provided, this device will not be provisioned a production interface.

params.name: device_management_cabinet
params.description: Optional. This is the cabinet where the desired management switch resides. If not provided, this device will not be provisioned a management interface.

endpoints.title: Onboard Physical Server (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. Name of the device.

params.name: mlag
params.description: Required. true/false. Specifies whether all device interfaces will be aggregated using MLAG.

params.name: bridge_mode
params.description: Required. Set switchports to either `trunk` or `access`.

params.name: vlans
params.description: Required. A list of vlans to provision on device interfaces. If `bridge_mode` is set to `access`, only the first vlan will be applied. These VLANs must already be defined for the site. Those that are not will not be applied.

params.name: native_vlan
params.description: Optional. Native VLAN for this server.

params.name: device_mac
params.description: Optional. MAC address of the management interface. Must be a valid format per https://netaddr.readthedocs.io/en/stable/tutorial\_02.html#formatting. MAC will be converted and saved as the UNIX extended format, i.e. `00:1b:77:49:54:fd`. Must be provided if device has a management interface.

params.name: speed
params.description: Optional. Port speed may be manually specified if device does not support auto-negotiation. Valid options are `100g`, `50g`, `40g`, `25g`, `10g`, `1g`, `100full` (100 Mbps), or `10full` (10 Mbps). `100full` and `10full` are only valid options when device uplinks to 1 Gbps switches.

params.name: mgmt_vlan_name
params.description: Optional. Can specify the vlan\_name to be used for the management interface. Defaults to `server_mgmt`.

params.name: mgmt_record_type
params.description: Optional. Set IPAM records to `STATIC` or `DHCP_RESERVED`. Defaults to `STATIC`.

endpoints.title: Register Adhoc Pure Storage Device (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: topology_name
params.description: Required. Topology where the device will be added (the topology name is always the same as the site name).

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. Name of the device.

params.name: device_model
params.description: Required. The name of the device model. One of: `xl130-type1`, `c90-type1`, `c90-type2`, `x70-type1`, `c70-type1`.

params.name: device_pod
params.description: Required. Pod in which this device will reside.

params.name: device_cabinet
params.description: Required. Cabinet where this device will reside.

params.name: device_service_cabinet
params.description: Optional. This parameter specifies that the device can uplink to switches in other cabinets besides its own. If not provided, this device can only uplink to switches in its local cabinet.

params.name: device_management_cabinet
params.description: Optional. JSON field. This is the cabinet(s) where the desired management switch resides. If not provided, this device will not be provisioned a management interface. Must be in the following format: `{"1": "CL1F14", "2": "CL1F15"}`. Determines number (should be 2) of mgmt interfaces to allocate and which mgmt switch cabinets to connect to.

params.name: file_server
params.description: Optional. Boolean. Set to `true` to indicate this device should have file server interfaces allocated - availability will depend on model selected.

params.name: replication
params.description: Optional. Boolean. Set to `true` to indicate this device should have replication interfaces allocated - availability will depend on model selected.

params.name: lacp
params.description: Optional. Build LACP (port-channel) interfaces, total of 2 for each controller. Only applied to file server interfaces, so this will only take effect if `file_server` field is set to `true`.

endpoints.title: Get Pure Storage Device Task Status

params.name: child_task_id
params.description: Required. The task id to get status and request/result information about. Will be provided by the POST/PUT methods when onboarding or updating the device.

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. Name of the device.

params.name: device_mac
params.description: Required. MAC address of the to use for mgmt IP assignment (can be a bogus MAC if one not available - IPs will be statically assigned for pure storage). Must be a valid format per https://netaddr.readthedocs.io/en/stable/tutorial\_02.html#formatting. MAC will be converted and saved as the UNIX extended format, i.e. `00:1b:77:49:54:fd`

params.name: iscsi_vlan
params.description: Required. Integer of VLAN to be used when configuring switch interfaces for iscsi ports. All pure storage devices will have iscsi, this VLAN is required.

params.name: file_server_vlan
params.description: Optional. Integer of VLAN to be used when configuring switch interfaces for file server ports. Only request if file server ports were requested during registration.

params.name: replication_vlan
params.description: Optional. Integer of VLAN to be used when configuring switch interfaces for replication ports. Only request if replication ports were requested during registration.

endpoints.title: Update Pure Storage Device (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. Name of the device.

params.name: iscsi_vlan
params.description: Optional. Integer of VLAN to be used when configuring switch interfaces for iscsi ports. All pure storage devices will have iscsi, supplying this field will reprocess those interfaces.

params.name: file_server_vlan
params.description: Optional. Integer of VLAN to be used when configuring switch interfaces for file server ports. Will allow adding file interfaces to a device that did not previously have them, or it will reprocess existing interfaces.

params.name: replication_vlan
params.description: Optional. Integer of VLAN to be used when configuring switch interfaces for replication ports. Will allow adding replication interfaces to a device that did not previously have them, or it will reprocess existing interfaces.

params.name: baremetal_neighbor_model
params.description: Optional. Model of switches that will host the uplinks for pure interfaces using a profile uplinked to baremetal neighbors.

params.name: compute_neighbor_model
params.description: Optional. Model of switches that will host the uplinks for pure interfaces using a profile uplinked to compute neighbors.

params.name: lacp
params.description: Optional. Build LACP (port-channel) interfaces, total of 2 for each controller. Only applied to file server interfaces, so this will only take effect if `file_server_vlan` field is populated.

endpoints.title: Lockout Arista Switch (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: hostname
params.description: Required. Hostname of the device.

params.name: lockout
params.description: Required. Used to set the admin\_status of an Arista device. `hard_lockout` means Skynet will not push any changes to the device. `soft_lockout` means Skynet will stage changes for the device, but those changes must be validated and pushed manually via CVP. `up` releases any lockouts from the device.

endpoints.title: Add Arista Ethernet Numbering Profile (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: model
params.description: Required. The model name of the Arista switch the profile will be used for. This must be an exact match as defined in the topology cable map profiles.

params.name: interface_profile
params.description: Required. The profile to create for the specified model. This should be a JSON object with keys being the range of interfaces (single interface should be "1-1" for example). The values are the notation to add to the range with the `/`. Full example: `{"1-5": null, "6-10": "/1", "11-11": "/1/1"}`

endpoints.title: Update Arista Ethernet Numbering Profile (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: id
params.description: Required. The ID number of the profile to update (use GET to find the ID).

params.name: model
params.description: Required. The model name of the Arista switch the profile will be used for. This must be an exact match as defined in the topology cable map profiles.

params.name: interface_profile
params.description: Required. The profile to create for the specified model. This should be a JSON object with keys being the range of interfaces (single interface should be "1-1" for example). The values are the notation to add to the range with the `/`. Full example: `{"1-5": null, "6-10": "/1", "11-11": "/1/1"}`

endpoints.title: Delete Arista Ethernet Numbering Profile (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: id
params.description: Required. The ID number of the profile to update (use GET to find the ID).

endpoints.title: Register a List of Adhoc Devices (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: topology_name
params.description: Required. Topology where the device(s) will be added (the topology name is always the same as the site name).

params.name: new_devices
params.description: Required. List of the new devices to add to the site/topology. This is a list of JSON objects - see below for parameters.

endpoints.title: Register Adhoc Miscellaneous Device (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: topology_name
params.description: Required. Topology where the device will be added (the topology name is always the same as the site name).

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. Name of the device.

params.name: device_layer
params.description: Required. Layer at which this device operates, i.e. `mgmt_con`, `campus_sdwan`, `endpoint_pdu`, etc.

params.name: device_model
params.description: Required. The name of the device model, i.e. `supermicro`, `im7248`, `generic_pdu`, etc.

params.name: device_pod
params.description: Required. Pod in which this device will reside.

params.name: device_cabinet
params.description: Required. Cabinet where this device will reside.

params.name: device_service_cabinet
params.description: Optional (remove field if not needed). This parameter specifies that the device can uplink to switches in other cabinets besides its own. If not provided, this device can only uplink to switches in its local cabinet.

params.name: device_management_cabinet
params.description: Optional (remove field if not needed). This is the cabinet where the desired management switch resides. If not provided, this device will not be provisioned a management interface.

params.name: device_console_cabinet
params.description: Optional (remove field if not needed). This is the cabinet where the desired console switch resides. If not provided, this device will not be provisioned a console interface.

endpoints.title: Re-Cable Devices - Get Existing Cabling (Requires Security: Network)

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. The name of the device to get cabling data for.

params.name: device_type
params.description: Required. The device type (can be one of 'arista\_device', 'esxi\_device', 'phy\_device').

params.name: device_re_cable_type
params.description: Required. Type of cabling to get data for. Can be one of 'uplinks', 'management', 'console'.

params.name: device_uplink_profile
params.description: Required for 'uplinks', Not used for 'management' and 'console' device\_re\_cable\_type. Profile that determines which set of uplinks to retrieve based on profile. See below for parameters.

params.name: model
params.description: Required. The model of the device retrieving uplink cabling for.

params.name: layer
params.description: Required. The layer of the device retrieving uplink cabling for.

params.name: neighbor_model
params.description: Required. The model of the neighbor device retrieving uplink cabling for.

params.name: neighbor_layer
params.description: Required. The layer of the neighbor device retrieving uplink cabling for.

endpoints.title: Re-Cable Devices (Requires Security: Network)

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. The name of the device to re-cable.

params.name: device_type
params.description: Required. The device type (can be one of 'arista\_device', 'esxi\_device', 'phy\_device') of the device to re-cable.

params.name: device_re_cable_type
params.description: Required. Type of cabling to re-cable for the requested device. Can be one of 'uplinks', 'management', 'console'.

params.name: device_uplink_profile
params.description: Required for 'uplinks', NOT used for 'management' and 'console' device\_re\_cable\_type. Profile that determines which set of uplinks to re-cable based on profile. See below for parameters.

params.name: model
params.description: Required. The model of the device to re-cable uplinks for.

params.name: layer
params.description: Required. The layer of the device to re-cable uplinks for.

params.name: neighbor_model
params.description: Required. The model of the neighbor device to re-cable uplinks to.

params.name: neighbor_layer
params.description: Required. The layer of the neighbor device to re-cable uplinks to.

endpoints.title: Get SDN Device Information (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: site
params.description: Required. The site code for the site to retrieve device(s) information from.

params.name: include_properties
params.description: Optional. Flag to indicate whether or not to include the device profile and properties information. Default is true.

params.name: hostname
params.description: Optional. Hostname of a device to filter results to; if hostname or device\_id parameters are not set, will return all devices for the site.

params.name: device_id
params.description: Optional. Device ID of a device to filter results to; if hostname or device\_id parameters are not set, will return all devices for the site

endpoints.title: Update SDN Device Information (Requires Security: NETWORK)

params.name: device_name
params.description: Required. The name of the device to update.

params.name: service_locations
params.description: Optional. JSON. Cabinet(s) that this device services. Must be in the following format, can be one or more: `{"1": "K54", "2": "K55"}`.

params.name: fabric
params.description: Optional. The fabric the device resides in. One of: `cloud`, `mgmt`.

params.name: location
params.description: Optional. The cabinet the device resides in.

params.name: status
params.description: Optional. The status of the device (use sparingly).

params.name: device_model
params.description: Optional. The device model.

params.name: device_layer
params.description: Optional. Layer of the device. (ex. `pure_storage`, `generic_compute`, `leaf_baremetal`, etc.)

params.name: device_peer_link
params.description: Optional. If a device has a peer link, should be the name of the peer device.

params.name: device_mgmt_cabinet
params.description: Optional. JSON. The management cabinet(s) that this device will allocate self mgmt interfaces to. Must be in the following format, can be one or more: `{"1": "K54", "2": "K55"}`.

params.name: device_console_cabinet
params.description: Optional. JSON. The console cabinet(s) that this device will allocate self mgmt interfaces to. Must be in the following format, can be one or more: `{"1": "K54", "2": "K55"}`.

params.name: device_pod
params.description: Optional. The pod string value that this device resides in. A device will already have a pod id (use GET method to view), that cannot be changed; however, this string value occasionally gets out of sync with the id. This field can be used to ensure they match. Ex. `p01`, `p02`, etc. `p00` should be null.

params.name: device_config_id
params.description: Optional. The configuration ID used by the device that determines how the device will assign numbering to various config. Use sparingly, this can impact config significantly.
